EnglishScore: If English is not your native language, you must demonstrate English proficiency. Stony Brook accepts the TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo, and PTE academic tests. Your scores must be less than two years old.

For applicants whose native language is not English, one of the following exams is required with the specified minimum score: TOEFL: 80, IELTS: 6.5, Duolingo English Test (DET): 105, PTE Academic: 53, or completion of the ELS Language Center Level 112.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Africana Studies

EnglishScore: If English is not your native language, you must take one of the following exams and meet the minimum score requirement: TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo, or PTE Academic.

All international students must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be done by submitting official scores from one of the following exams: TOEFL (minimum score of 80 on the internet-based test), IELTS (minimum composite score of 6.5), Duolingo English Test (minimum score of 105), or PTE Academic (minimum score of 53). Students may be exempt if they achieve a 550 or higher on the SAT Evidence-Based Reading and Writing section or a 22 or higher on the ACT English section, or if their native language is English.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Applied Mathematics & Statistics
